text: Daniele D'Onofrio (born 8 October 1993) is an Italian male long-distance runner, who won two gold medal with the Italian team at the European 10,000m Cup. ==Biography== His most important international achievement was the bronze medal won at the 2016 European Athletics Championships. ==Achievements== {| class="wikitable" width=60% style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !Year !!Competition !!Venue !!Position !!Event!!Time!!Notes |- | rowspan=2|2015 | rowspan=2 align=left|European 10,000m Cup | rowspan=2 align=left| Cagliari | 20th | 10,000 m | 30:15.65 | |- | bgcolor=gold|1st | 10,000 m team | 1:26:23,97 | |- | rowspan=4|2016 | rowspan=2 align=left|European 10,000m Cup | rowspan=2 align=left| Mersin | 14th | 10,000 m | 30:07.87 | The time is calculated on the first three athletes of the nation, but also the other participants are awarded with the medal. |- | bgcolor=gold|1st | 10,000 m team | 1:25:39,81 | |- | rowspan=2 align=left|European Championships | rowspan=2 align=left| Amsterdam | 65th | Half marathon | 1:08:41 | |- | bgcolor=cc966|3rd | Half marathon team | 3:12.41 | |} ==National titles== * Italian Athletics Championships ** Half marathon: 2016, 2020 ==References== ==External links== * * Daniele D'Onofrio at FIDAL Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:Italian male long-distance runners Category:Athletics competitors of Fiamme Oro
title: Daniele D'Onofrio
